title: Patching Problem (Can't Play)
body:
I managed to fix this issue - kept the thread updated for anyone who googles this problem/other people needing to troubleshoot or riot staffers for advice :) 

After switching between OCE and NA and playing some games, my client crashed after one of the games, before the end of game stats. Closed with no freeze or not-responding, just shut down. 
Reopened, got the fairly common problem where clicking start would just close the screen and not launch, tried deleting the rads lol launcher, didn't fix it. Then tried deleting the OC1 config and air client with empty downloads/solution folders, restarted and relaunched as admin, didn't help either, it just crashed before opening. I then ran a repair via the setup in leagueoflegends folder, didn't help. Figured it would be faster to just do a clean reinstall and repatch, so I completely deleted the Riot Games folder and contents and re-downloaded from the OCE.leagueoflegends.come mirror, which worked up until about half an hour into patching when I got this Unspecified error message. 
Tried running in admin, restarting, and then running a repair through the client itself rather than the setup file which just scanned and then put me back at square one (see image)

It takes about 10 seconds to scan, then immediately skips to 32% and says the error occurred. I've checked the logs, I have 9 plain text files there but no idea what I'm looking for. 

Should I send this to support or is someone here capable of helping me?

replies.body:
New problem. 
Only thing I could think of was registry errors messing up the uninstall, so I ran a registry clean and defrag, rebooted and started patching again, this time it takes a while to get passed scanning differences and then starts "patching" at around 7kbps until 5%, then it stops and sits at 0.00kbps and doesn't change. 

So it would seem that the unspecified error was a registry problem, but that's caused a whole other issue with the repatching. Take note of that for the future boys :)

New log after last attempted patch : 

INFO: maestro [server] initializing...
ERROR: The file [] does not exist.  Expected path: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.15\deploy\.ERROR: The file [] does not exist.  Expected path: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.15\deploy\.ERROR: One or more of the required applications could not be found.
INFO: New thread go!
INFO: Starting Process Thread Spinning
INFO: [MaestroAgent_DebugLoop] The operation completed successfully.

ERROR: C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_patcher\releases\0.0.0.15\deployERROR: Failed to start process.
ERROR: Process Start: 183

After about 45 minutes of patching, hit a new high before stopping to 0.00kbps. My net monitor confirms I've downloaded about 4gb, but I don't even have a Leagueoflegends setup folder or anything anymore. 

Why is this installer so goddamn frustrating.
After running the batch and relaunching client, it still stopped at 260mb, but the % kept climbing, it took a while but eventually kbps recovered and the patch finished. Problem solved boys.

Might I say bravo on that. With that sort of knowledge of how your computer works then you should never contact support; you know a lot more than they do.

The batch file you used seems to be attempting to sync your computer's clock with the server's clock, and then restart the program when it does. Not sure how that's working but it seems to be.

I'll keep a note of that.
